trial_identification.studytitle: Tissue-engineered Regeneration of Tympanic Membrane (Ear Drum) Perforations
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Regeneration of tympanic membrane (ear drum) perforations using b-fibroblast growth factor and the impact on perforation closure rates and hearing outcomes

interventions.interventions: Surgical freshening of the perforation edges, followed by measurement of the perforation size. After this sizing of the scaffold to the dimensions of the perforation and introduction of the scaffold into the perforation sothat there is a snug fit of the scaffold in the perforation. Now application of human Fibroblast Growth Factor (FGF), followed by the blood seal and histoacryl cap. The entire procedure will take around 10 minutes.
interventions.comparator: Comparison of fibroblast growth factor(FGF) in combination with various scaffolds and by itself. 3 different scaffolds will be used, the surgical technique is the same with all the scaffolds so there will not be any change in duration of the intervention. The scaffolds compared will be: Gelfoam;collagen; fibroin. The control group consists of using the fibroblast growth factor on its own.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Rate of successful perforation closure will be assessed using videootoscopy with photographic capture of the perforation site at every follow up after surgery. The size of the preoperative perforation and any residual perforation post surgery will be measured using image analysis software (J image)

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Effects on Hearing thresholds with successful closure of the Air-bone gap. This will assessed using standard audiometers to measure pure tone average thresholds after documented closure of the perforation post surgery

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: dry ear drum perforation; perforation size smaller or equal to 50% percent of the drum surface
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: active middle ear infection ear discharge in the last 3 months allergy to bFGF or scaffold associated ossicular chain pathology

ethicsAndSummary.summary: To investigate the effects of bFGF on treatment of chronic ear drum perforations
